text.intro: Hello, my name is Jeremy Brown. I am a Software Engineer living in Portland, Oregon U.S.A. and working remotely with collaborators from around the globe. I work on a variety of software projects including data visualizations tools, chatbots and interactive experiences in immersive spaces. I'm currently most interested in working on projects that involve Machine Intelligence, Natural Langauge Processing and Data Visualization.

blog.title: Multiple Python kernels for Jupyter Lab with Conda
Google Cloud Storage File Upload with Flask & JavaScript

employment.title: Software Engineer (Contract)
descriptions: Developing over twenty-five custom software projects for The San Francisco Museum of Modern Art, The Smithsonian, Nike and many other clients from around the U.S. and Canada
Generating project roadmaps, estimates of cost, software schematics and end user documentation
Collaborating with remote teams using Slack, Git, SVN, Atlassian Tools and Target Process
Studying fields of interest, including deep learning and natural language processing, with end goal of attaining work in new fields

employment.title: Software Engineer, Textwise
descriptions: Developing the Semantic Map, an interactive data visualization tool enabling search and exploration of ten million patent document corpus using JavaScript & D3

Developing domain specific query language based on provided Backus-Nuar form grammar using C++ for server side syntax parsing and JavaScript with D3 for front end and visualization of abstract syntax tree data structures

employment.title: Creative Technologist, Upswell
descriptions: Architecting and engineering user analytics APIs using Python, Flask and InfluxDB for tracking anonymous metrics in immersive installation software
Prototyping and experimenting with new technologies including Arduino and Heroic Robotics LED strips, fingerprint sensors and image compositing techniques in OSX
Developing Microsoft Kinect controlled interactive experience for Clemson University using Cinder
Developing multiple interactive touch screen applications with Swift, iOS and macOS Desktop for The Nevada Discovery Museum

employment.title: Interactive Developer, Second Story Interactive
descriptions: Developing award winning interactive digital installations for museums and cultural institutions
Maintaining and extending MVC application framework used by development teams
Designed performance tests for simulating user input over extended periods for analysis and optimization of CPU/GPU performance and memory consumption
Leading research and feasibility studies of new technologies for potential company-wide adoption

projects.description: The Search Spheres are an experimental search interface that I developed for my collaborators over at Upswell for Bell Labs. Increasingly dense spheres represent a collection of search results, with the most relevant results at the center. With pinch and zoom gestures, users can fluidly scan and rotate through hundreds of search results with ease.
projects.title: Search Spheres
projects.tldr: An experimental geometric search interface

projects.description: Patch is a so-called Smart Bot, a concept that I have been working on for a couple of years. As a smart bot, Patch uses various artificial intelligence techniques to learn all about a specialized topic. In Patch's case, he knows all about analog synthesizers. It can carry on a basic conversation with both novices and experienced enthusiast. I am currently seeking new work that involves building other types of smart bots like Patch for museums or other phsyical spaces.
projects.title: Patch the Synthbot
projects.tldr: A know it all synthesizer geek chatbot

projects.description: Canvas is a scalable and cross platform content presentation software capable of displaying full-screen web apps on touch screens in public spaces. It allows content producers using the Storycrafter platform to easily publish content without the need for manually copying content using removable media or otherwise. I architected and developed both the front end desktop application and the server side application that connects to the Storycrafter CMS and notifies deployments of content updates.
projects.title: Storycrafter Canvas
projects.tldr: Content publishing for public spaces, made easy

projects.description: Metonym is an open source web app that I develop and maintain, designed to enable chatbot creators and others who require large amounts of conversational data to quickly generating it from a few examples. The application provides a small scripting langauge for transforming a single line of formatted text into thousands of permutations.
projects.title: Metonym NLP Training Tool
projects.tldr: A tool for generating NLP training data
